Larry Page speaking to the European Parliament, 2009. An`` unexpected shakeup'' went down at Google today. Larry Page, company co-founder, will take over as CEO effective April 4. Page, 37, is reclaiming the top job from Eric Schmidt , who had been brought in as CEO a decade ago because Google's investors believed the company needed a more mature leader, reports KTVU.`` Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain an adviser to Page and Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , as Google's executive chairman.'' which he resigned after a reporter and a private investigator were imprisoned for phone-tapping in 2007. In appointing Andy Coulson , David Cameron judged his experience and skills outweighed the political risk that the phone-tapping scandal might resurface. The cloud of allegations surrounding Andy Coulson 's tenure at the News of the World raised real questions about his ability to be at the heart of the Downing Street machine. He's now done the right thing but he should have done it earlier, Labour leader Ed Miliband told reporters.`` I think it raises real questions about David Cameron 's judgment that he hung on to Andy Coulson for so long.''
